example_en: I watch the news every morning.
The reporter was live from the scene.
She wrote an article about climate change.
The interview with the president was broadcast live.
The news broadcast starts at six.
The press covered the event extensively.
The editor approved the final version.
He writes a weekly column for the newspaper.
A reliable source confirmed the story.
The media plays an important role in society.
My grandfather reads the newspaper every day.
She subscribes to a fashion magazine.
Our foreign correspondent reports from London.
example_ka: ჩვენი საზღვარგარეთის კორესპონდენტი ლონდონიდან აწვდის ინფორმაციას.

example_en: The deadline for the article is tomorrow.
The TV coverage of the event was excellent.
The newspaper published an exclusive story.
The news anchor presented the evening news.
Everyone has the right to their own opinion.
Media bias can influence public opinion.
example_ka: მედიის მიკერძოებულობამ შეიძლება საზოგადოებრივ აზრზე იმოქმედოს.

example_en: The political scandal shocked the nation.
The reporter got a major scoop.
The newspaper has a large circulation.
She works as a freelance journalist.
I listen to news podcasts during my commute.
The article included a quote from the minister.
The source wished to remain anonymous.
Fact verification is crucial in journalism.
This is breaking news from downtown.
The story is trending on social media.
The photo caption explains the scene.
Her byline appears on the front page.
example_ka: მისი ავტორის სახელი პირველ გვერდზე ჩანს.

example_en: The dateline shows where the story was filed.
example_ka: თარიღი აჩვენებს სადიდან იყო ამბავი გაგზავნილი.

example_en: The newsroom was busy on election night.
The evening newscast starts at seven.
Newsprint is cheaper than regular paper.
The story came from a major newswire.
The press briefing was held at noon.
The press conference was broadcast live.
The news was under embargo until midnight.
A correction was printed the next day.
We'll provide updates as they develop.
A news alert was sent to subscribers.
We interrupt for a special news bulletin.
This is a news flash from our studios.
Breaking news appeared on the ticker.
The webcast reached millions of viewers.
The show was simulcast on radio and TV.
example_ka: შოუ რადიოსა და ტელევიზიაზე ერთდროულად გადმოვიდა.

example_en: The anchor read from the teleprompter.

example_ka: დოკუმენტურ ფილმში პროფესიონალური გახმოვანება იყო გამოყენებული.

example_en: The news report included expert narration.
The reporter went undercover to expose fraud.
The magazine published an exposé on corruption.
The press serves as a government watchdog.
The story turned out to be a hoax.

example_ka: სოციალური მედია ცრუ ინფორმაციას სწრაფად ავრცელებს.

example_en: Don't believe every rumor you hear.
A government leak revealed the documents.
Press freedom is vital for democracy.
The First Amendment protects free speech.
Broadcast licensing is controlled by government.
Large media conglomerates own many outlets.
example_ka: დიდი მედია კონგლომერატები ბევრ გამცემს ფლობენ.

example_en: Social media algorithms shape news consumption.
example_ka: სოციალური მედიის ალგორითმები ახალი ამბების მოხმარებას აყალიბებს.
ბევრი საინფორმაციო საიტი ფასიან კედელს იყენებს.

example_en: Social media engagement measures audience interest.
example_ka: სოციალური მედიის ჩართულობა აუდიტორიის ინტერესს ზომავს.

example_en: The article generated millions of impressions.
The show targets a younger demographic.
example_ka: შოუ უფრო ახალგაზრდა დემოგრაფიულ ჯგუფს სამიზნედ ისახავს.

example_en: The magazine has a specific target audience.
The publication serves a niche market.
Mainstream media covers general interest stories.
example_ka: მეინსტრიმი მედია ზოგადი ინტერესის ამბებს აშუქებს.

example_en: Commercial news relies on advertising revenue.
example_ka: კომერციული ახალი ამბები სარეკლამო შემოსავალზეა დამოკიდებული.
